conclusion: To determine if the two objects have the same acceleration at time t_1, we need to analyze the velocity-time graph provided.
The graph shows the velocity v as a function of time t for two objects, A and B.
The slope of the velocity-time graph gives the acceleration. Specifically, the acceleration a is given by the derivative of the velocity with respect to time, a = dv/dt.
At time t_1, we need to find the slopes of the velocity-time graphs for objects A and B.
The slope of the graph at any point is the tangent to the curve at that point.
For object A, the tangent at t_1 is a straight line with a negative slope.
This indicates that object A is decelerating.
For object B, the tangent at t_1 is also a straight line with a negative slope.
This indicates that object B is decelerating as well.
By observing the slopes of the tangents at t_1 for both objects, we can see that the slopes are equal.
This means that the accelerations of both objects are the same at t_1.
Since the slopes of the tangents at t_1 are equal, the accelerations of the two objects are the same at t_1.
